author: Unreal Engine
description:
Enjoy highlights from the product cinematics created during the second four-week Unreal Fellowship: Product Storytelling at Epic Games Novi Sad!

Twelve participants experimented with different epochs, worlds, styles, references, and narratives — showcasing the possibilities of Unreal Engine and MetaHuman technology in advertising and communication.
title: Unreal Fellowship: Product Storytelling I Sizzle Reel - June, 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
UE5 LEVEL OPTIMIZATION SECRETS: Master your cinematic environment by understanding how the Master Level uses nested sub-levels (for lighting, damage decals, assets) to enable crucial organizational control and support multi-artist production workflows. Crucially, understand the difference between possessible assets that persist in the world and spawnable assets (like characters and cameras) that only appear for specific shots, giving you control over dynamic scene changes. This is essential for managing large Unreal Engine projects
►Download the A-COM Animation Sample here: https://epic.gm/agora-animation-sample
► Check out Sir Wade's channel for more Animation Tutorials and UE5 workflows: https://www.youtube.com/@SirWade/
► Sir Wade's Courses: https://courses.sirwade.com

#Animation, #ACOMAnimaticSample, #UnrealEngine5.6, #AgoraStudio
title: Level Management: Sub-Levels, Spawnables, Possessibles in UE5

author: Unreal Engine
description:
Watch this video and learn how to set up a MetaHuman so it can be used seamlessly with Unreal Engine's Mocap Manager.

Don’t miss the other episodes in our Animation Hub series—a collection of tutorials designed to get you up to speed with animation in Unreal Engine, fast. 

For more information, visit the EDC page for this tutorial: https://dev.epicgames.com/community/learning/tutorials/abRR/unreal-engine-metahumans-for-mocap

Want to learn more about animating in Unreal Engine? Take a look here: unrealengine.com/uses/animation

#Animation, #UnrealEngine, #MetaHuman, #MocapManager, #DigitalHumans, #UE5
title: MetaHumans for Mocap | Unreal Engine Animation Hub

author: Unreal Engine
description:
In this talk recorded at Unreal Fest Stockholm, we explore how physically simulated characters can be created and controlled within the framework of Control Rig. This has the potential to transform the way game developers and content creators portray powerful and believable characters. 

Traditionally, adding simulation to characters in UE has been straightforward, so long as the setup is simple and secondary (e.g. ponytail). 

It is much harder to set up physics to work directly alongside animation, operating on the same bones that the animator is authoring. Animators and game developers need tools to enable physics to contribute to the realism of the movement while letting the animator tell the story through the character.

Control Rig already exposes a rich set of tools, enabling animators to concentrate on being expressive. Integrating physics simulation into these tools enables animators to use exactly the amount and type of simulation they need, and to animate and control the ef
title: Control Rig Physics: Fast, Fun, and Expressive Character Animation | Unreal Fest Stockholm 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
Watch this video to find out how KÄÄPÄ Biotech uses RealityScan Mobile to accurately track the growth of chaga mushrooms over decades.

Deep in the forests of Finland, KÄÄPÄ Forest—a division of KÄÄPÄ Biotech—manages the largest chaga mushroom cultivation network in the world. 
As one of the world’s leading innovators in sustainable mushroom farming, KÄÄPPÄ BIOTECH has embraced cutting-edge technologies, including the use of photorealistic 3D scanning to assess mushroom growth.

Read the full article here: https://epic.gm/spotlight-kaapa-biotech


#ChagaMushrooms, #KÄÄPÄBiotech, #KÄÄPÄForest, #3DScanning, #Photogrammetry, #RealityScanMobile
title: Bringing accuracy to mushroom measuring with RealityScan Mobile
